intro: Trixella arvensis, commonly known as the field morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and is native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually violet or blue in color, blooming in the morning. Its stems are twining and can climb or trail, while its leaves are heart-shaped with a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
